intro: Lappula echinata var. occidentalis, commonly known as western prickly lettuce, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and a distinctive, spiny fruiting structure called a schizocarp. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The species is part of the family Camelotaceae and is known for its adaptability to arid environments.
